intro: Parathesis ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty parathesis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and showy, yellow flowers with five petals. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a rough texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
